dprint_X.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /* The following is a set of functions intended primarily to facilitate 
00002 debugging.  But, they could easily be used for verbose data output within
00003 the program.  They all follow the same basic format:
00004 
00005 print_X(X x, int level)
00006 
00007 where   X = one of the structures defined above (e.g., molecule, residue, 
00008                 bondset, atom, bond, atype, plane, vectormag_3D, coord_3D).
00009         *x = pointer to your structure
00010         level = the depth to print.  This is only available on structures 
00011                 likely to contain arrays of other structures.  level=0 only
00012                 prints the top-level information.  level=1 prints one level 
00013                 down of other structures, lists, etc. level=2 prints two 
00014                 levels down, etc.   The value of level can be larger than 
00015                 the depth available -- the function will stop when it runs
00016                 out of structures to print.  
00017   Author: Lachele Foley
00018 */
00019 #include <mylib.h>
00020 #include <molecules.h>
00021 //#include "../inc/mylib.h"
00022 //#include "../inc/molecules.h"
00023 void dprint_coord_3D(coord_3D *c){
00024         printf("coord i j k \t%20.12f \t%20.12f \t%20.12f\n",c[0].i,c[0].j,c[0].k);
00025 return;
00026 }
00027 
00028 void dprint_vectormag_3D(vectormag_3D *v){
00029         printf("vectormag i j k d \t%20.12f \t%20.12f \t%20.12f \t%20.12f\n",v[0].i,v[0].j,v[0].k,v[0].d); 
00030 return;
00031 }

00033 void dprint_plane(plane *p){
00034         printf("plane A B C D \t%20.12f \t%20.12f \t%20.12f \t%20.12f\n",p[0].A,p[0].B,p[0].C,p[0].D); 
00035 return;
00036 }

00038 void dprint_atype(atype *t,int i){
00039         int pa=0,psz=0,puse=0,pbins=0;
00040         printf("atype \tn=%d ; N=>>%s<< ; NT=>>%s<< ; m=%20.12f ; nb=%d\n",t[0].n,t[0].N,t[0].NT,t[0].m,t[0].nb);
00041         printf("\tdesc=>>%s<<\n",t[0].desc);
00042         if(i>0){ 
00043                 puse=malloc_usable_size(t[0].bo);
00044                 psz=sizeof(double);
00045                 pbins=puse/psz; 
00046                 printf("\t%d bond orders have been allocated: ",pbins);
00047                 for(pa=0;((pa<i)&&(pa<t[0].nb)&&(pa<pbins));pa++){
00048                         printf("\t%20.12f",t[0].bo[pa]);
00049                         }
00050                 printf("\n");
00051                 }
00052 return;
00053 }
00054 
00055 void dprint_bond(bond *b){
00056         printf("bond s t o \t%d \t%d \t%20.12f\n",b[0].s,b[0].t,b[0].o);
00057 return;
00058 }

00060 void dprint_atom(atom *a,int i){
00061         int pa=0,psz=0,puse=0,pbins=0;
00062         printf("atom \tn=%d ; N=>>%s<< ; t=%d ; nb=%d ; nalt=%d ; nvec=%d\n",a[0].n,a[0].N,\
00063                 a[0].t,a[0].nb,a[0].nalt,a[0].nvec);
00064         printf("\tcoords x y z \t%20.12f \t%20.12f \t%20.12f\n",a[0].x.i,a[0].x.j,a[0].x.k); 
00065         if(i>0){
00066                 puse=malloc_usable_size(a[0].b);
00067                 psz=sizeof(bond);
00068                 pbins=puse/psz; 
00069                 printf("\t%d bonds have been allocated: \n",pbins);
00070                 for(pa=0;((pa<i)&&(pa<a[0].nb)&&(pa<pbins));pa++){
00071                         printf("\tbond set %d:  ",pa);
00072                         dprint_bond(&(a[0].b[pa])); 
00073                         }
00074                 puse=malloc_usable_size(a[0].xa);
00075                 psz=sizeof(coord_3D);
00076                 pbins=puse/psz; 
00077                 printf("\t%d alternate coordinates have been allocated: \n",pbins);
00078                 for(pa=0;((pa<i)&&(pa<a[0].nalt)&&(pa<pbins));pa++){
00079                         printf("\talt coord set %d:  ",pa);
00080                         dprint_coord_3D(&(a[0].xa[pa])); 
00081                         }
00082                 puse=malloc_usable_size(a[0].v);
00083                 psz=sizeof(vectormag_3D);
00084                 pbins=puse/psz; 
00085                 printf("\t%d vectors have been allocated: \n",pbins);
00086                 for(pa=0;((pa<i)&&(pa<a[0].nvec)&&(pa<pbins));pa++){
00087                         printf("\tset %d:  ",pa);
00088                         dprint_vectormag_3D(&(a[0].v[pa])); 
00089                         }
00090                 } 
00091 return;
00092 }

00094 void dprint_bondset(bondset *bs,int i){
00095         int pa=0,psz=0,puse=0,pbins=0;
00096         printf("bondset contains n=%d bonds\n",bs[0].n);
00097         if(i>0){
00098                 puse=malloc_usable_size(bs[0].b);
00099                 psz=sizeof(bond);
00100                 pbins=puse/psz; 
00101                 printf("\t%d consecutive bonds have been allocated: \n",pbins);
00102                 for(pa=0;((pa<i)&&(pa<bs[0].n)&&(pa<pbins));pa++){
00103                         printf("\tconsec bonds set %d : \t",pa);
00104                         dprint_bond(&(bs[0].b[pa]));
00105                         }
00106                 }
00107 return;
00108 }

00110 void dprint_residue(residue *r,int i){
00111         int pa=0,psz=0,puse=0,pbins=0;
00112         printf("residue \tn=%d ; N=>>%s<< ; na=%d ; nbs=%d ; nr=%d \n",r[0].n,r[0].N,\
00113                 r[0].na,r[0].nbs,r[0].nr); 
00114         if(i>0){
00115                 puse=malloc_usable_size(r[0].a);
00116                 psz=sizeof(atom);
00117                 pbins=puse/psz; 
00118                 //printf("usable return is %d, size is %d, bins is %d\n",puse,psz,pbins);
00119                 printf("\t%d atoms have been allocated: \n",pbins);
00120                 for(pa=0;((pa<i)&&(pa<r[0].na)&&(pa<pbins));pa++){
00121                         printf("\tatom set %d\n",pa);
00122                         dprint_atom(&(r[0].a[pa]),i); 
00123                         }
00124                 puse=malloc_usable_size(r[0].bs);
00125                 psz=sizeof(bondset);
00126                 pbins=puse/psz; 
00127                 printf("\t%d consecutive, linear bonds have been allocated: \n",pbins);
00128                 for(pa=0;((pa<i)&&(pa<r[0].nbs)&&(pa<pbins));pa++){
00129                         printf("\tconsec. lin, bondset set %d\n",pa);
00130                         dprint_bondset(&(r[0].bs[pa]),i); 
00131                         }
00132                 puse=malloc_usable_size(r[0].rbs);
00133                 psz=sizeof(bondset);
00134                 pbins=puse/psz; 
00135                 printf("\t%d consecutive ring bonds have been allocated: \n",pbins);
00136                 for(pa=0;((pa<i)&&(pa<r[0].nrbs)&&(pa<pbins));pa++){
00137                         printf("\tconsec. ring bondset set %d\n",pa);
00138                         dprint_bondset(&(r[0].rbs[pa]),i); 
00139                         }
00140                 puse=malloc_usable_size(r[0].rc);
00141                 psz=sizeof(coord_3D);
00142                 pbins=puse/psz; 
00143                 printf("\t%d ring center coordinates have been allocated: \n",pbins);
00144                 for(pa=0;((pa<i)&&(pa<r[0].nrc)&&(pa<pbins));pa++){
00145                         printf("\tconsec ring coords set %d:  ",pa);
00146                         dprint_coord_3D(&(r[0].rc[pa])); 
00147                         }
00148                 puse=malloc_usable_size(r[0].rp);
00149                 psz=sizeof(plane);
00150                 pbins=puse/psz; 
00151                 printf("\t%d ring plane equations have been allocated: \n",pbins);
00152                 for(pa=0;((pa<i)&&(pa<r[0].nrp)&&(pa<pbins));pa++){
00153                         printf("\tring plane set %d:  ",pa);
00154                         dprint_plane(&(r[0].rp[pa])); 
00155                         }
00156                 } 
00157 return;
00158 }

00160 void dprint_molecule(molecule *m,int i){
00161         int pa=0,psz=0,puse=0,pbins=0;
00162         printf("molecule \ti=%d ; N=>>%s<< ; nr=%d \n",m[0].i,m[0].N,m[0].nr); 
00163         if(i>0){
00164                 puse=malloc_usable_size(m[0].r);
00165                 psz=sizeof(residue);
00166                 pbins=puse/psz; 
00167                 printf("\t%d residues have been allocated: \n",pbins);
00168                 for(pa=0;((pa<i)&&(pa<m[0].nr)&&(pa<pbins));pa++){
00169                         printf("\t\tset %d\n",pa);
00170                         dprint_residue(&(m[0].r[pa]),i); 
00171                         }
00172                 }
00173 return;
00174 }
